Updated November     pm





Senior Dylan Lydy slams Clarions Wohlebaugh to the mat to complete a  win during a dual meet in November PERIOD Lydy took first at the Cliff Keen Las Vegas Invitational last weekend preserving an undefeated season PERIOD

No PERIOD  Purdue wrestling posted a historic fifth place finish last weekend in the Cliff Keen Las Vegas Invitational PERIOD With three finalists and five placers the wrestlers earned a programhigh . points PERIOD

 of the top  NCAA D1 teams entered the tournament so posting a top5 score turned some heads PERIOD Closely following Purdue  in team scores were No PERIOD  Iowa State No PERIOD  Minnesota No PERIOD  NC State and No PERIOD  Northwestern PERIOD

Senior Dylan Lydy led the Boilers with a first place finish PERIOD Lydy consistently outlasted his opponents finishing three of his five matches in overtime PERIOD

He faced Nebraskas No PERIOD  seed Mike Labriola in the semifinals PERIOD Last season Lydy lost after going to double overtime with Labriola in both the Big Ten championships and the NCAA championships PERIOD Lydy went to overtime with Labriola at the CKLV but avenged last seasons losses with a blast double to make the finals PERIOD Another overtime win made Lydy the first Boilermaker to win the CKLV since  PERIOD

Junior Devin Schroder also made a finals appearance PERIOD Schroder won each of his matches by three or more points including a pin in the round of  PERIOD This is true to Schroders reputation as a highscorer he led the NCAA in tech falls earlier this season and consistently earns bonus points PERIOD In the finals Schroder lost  to Virginias Jack Mueller despite earning a takedown in the second period PERIOD Mueller will seek qualification for the Olympic trials in the coming weeks PERIOD

Senior Christian Brunner improved from No PERIOD  seed to runnerup PERIOD Brunner was absent from early season competition due to injury which contributed to his lower seeding PERIOD The strong tournament performance should add Brunner to the top ten making him the fifth Boiler to do so this season PERIOD Brunner lost  to Ohio States Kollin Moore in the finals PERIOD

Other boilers on the podium included redshirt freshman Kendall Coleman and junior Griffin Parriott PERIOD

Coleman wrestled true to his seed placing fourth PERIOD Going into the tournament Coleman was undefeated with a 12match winning streak PERIOD He lost  to NC States Hayden Hidlay in the semifinals PERIOD

Parriott also placed fourth one below his seed PERIOD However his bracket saw some major upsets as the No PERIOD  seed and No PERIOD  seed met in the finals PERIOD He was pinned by Ohio States Sammy Sasso in the quarterfinals PERIOD Parriott took out the No PERIOD  seed in the consolation bracket on his way to placing fourth so the implications of the tournament on his rank are difficult to predict PERIOD

Purdue sent out a lineup that was more or less its strongest PERIOD Other schools had some notable absences for example Northwesterns Sebastian Rivera did not compete in the tournament PERIOD This could have some effect on the rankings but overall the Boilers are expected to make a huge jump in team standings PERIOD

Purdue will compete next in a dual against Southern Illinois University Edwardsville at  p.m PERIOD on December  PERIOD
